Unemployment: Nevada was ranked No. 1 in unemployment among states, with a rate of 13 percent in November 2011, according to the Bureau of Labor Statistics.
Violent Crime: Based on FBI statistics from 2010, Nevada had the second-highest rate of violent crime in the country, behind the District of Columbia.
Car Theft: According to FBI statistics from 2010, Nevada ranked third in the rate of car theft, behind California and Washington state.
Divorce: CQ Press data from 2009 and the National Center for Health Statistics showed that Nevada had the highest divorce rate among reporting states, with a rate of 6.7 per 1,000 population.
